qas.question: In what century did the term polytechnic first show up?
What school founded in 1794 first used a form of the word polytechnic in its name?
What language does the French word polytechnique come from?

context: The English term polytechnic appeared in the early <a0_0>19th century<a0_0/>, from the French <a1_0>École Polytechnique<a1_0/>, an engineering school founded in 1794 in Paris. The French term comes from the <a2_0>Greek<a2_0/> πολύ (polú or polý) meaning "many" and τεχνικός (tekhnikós) meaning "arts".
